documentation:
Amazon AppStream 2.0

This is the Amazon AppStream 2.0 API Reference. This documentation provides descriptions and syntax for each of the actions and data types in AppStream 2.0. AppStream 2.0 is a fully managed, secure application streaming service that lets you stream desktop applications to users without rewriting applications. AppStream 2.0 manages the AWS resources that are required to host and run your applications, scales automatically, and provides access to your users on demand.

You can call the AppStream 2.0 API operations by using an interface VPC endpoint (interface endpoint). For more information, see Access AppStream 2.0 API Operations and CLI Commands Through an Interface VPC Endpoint in the Amazon AppStream 2.0 Administration Guide.

To learn more about AppStream 2.0, see the following resources:

  • Amazon AppStream 2.0 product page

  • Amazon AppStream 2.0 documentation

AssociateFleet.documentation: Associates the specified fleet with the specified stack.
AssociateFleet.name: AssociateFleet

BatchAssociateUserStack.documentation: Associates the specified users with the specified stacks. Users in a user pool cannot be assigned to stacks with fleets that are joined to an Active Directory domain.
BatchAssociateUserStack.name: BatchAssociateUserStack

BatchDisassociateUserStack.documentation: Disassociates the specified users from the specified stacks.
BatchDisassociateUserStack.name: BatchDisassociateUserStack

CopyImage.documentation: Copies the image within the same region or to a new region within the same AWS account. Note that any tags you added to the image will not be copied.
CopyImage.name: CopyImage

CreateDirectoryConfig.documentation: Creates a Directory Config object in AppStream 2.0. This object includes the configuration information required to join fleets and image builders to Microsoft Active Directory domains.
CreateDirectoryConfig.name: CreateDirectoryConfig

CreateFleet.documentation: Creates a fleet. A fleet consists of streaming instances that run a specified image.
CreateFleet.name: CreateFleet

CreateImageBuilder.documentation:
Creates an image builder. An image builder is a virtual machine that is used to create an image.

The initial state of the builder is PENDING. When it is ready, the state is RUNNING.
CreateImageBuilder.name: CreateImageBuilder

CreateImageBuilderStreamingURL.documentation: Creates a URL to start an image builder streaming session.
CreateImageBuilderStreamingURL.name: CreateImageBuilderStreamingURL

CreateStack.documentation: Creates a stack to start streaming applications to users. A stack consists of an associated fleet, user access policies, and storage configurations.
CreateStack.name: CreateStack

CreateStreamingURL.documentation: Creates a temporary URL to start an AppStream 2.0 streaming session for the specified user. A streaming URL enables application streaming to be tested without user setup.
CreateStreamingURL.name: CreateStreamingURL

CreateUsageReportSubscription.documentation: Creates a usage report subscription. Usage reports are generated daily.
CreateUsageReportSubscription.name: CreateUsageReportSubscription

CreateUser.documentation: Creates a new user in the user pool.
CreateUser.name: CreateUser

DeleteDirectoryConfig.documentation: Deletes the specified Directory Config object from AppStream 2.0. This object includes the information required to join streaming instances to an Active Directory domain.
DeleteDirectoryConfig.name: DeleteDirectoryConfig

DeleteImage.documentation: Deletes the specified image. You cannot delete an image when it is in use. After you delete an image, you cannot provision new capacity using the image.
DeleteImage.name: DeleteImage

DeleteImageBuilder.documentation: Deletes the specified image builder and releases the capacity.
DeleteImageBuilder.name: DeleteImageBuilder

DeleteImagePermissions.documentation: Deletes permissions for the specified private image. After you delete permissions for an image, AWS accounts to which you previously granted these permissions can no longer use the image.
DeleteImagePermissions.name: DeleteImagePermissions

DeleteStack.documentation: Deletes the specified stack. After the stack is deleted, the application streaming environment provided by the stack is no longer available to users. Also, any reservations made for application streaming sessions for the stack are released.
DeleteStack.name: DeleteStack

DeleteUser.documentation: Deletes a user from the user pool.
DeleteUser.name: DeleteUser

DescribeDirectoryConfigs.documentation:
Retrieves a list that describes one or more specified Directory Config objects for AppStream 2.0, if the names for these objects are provided. Otherwise, all Directory Config objects in the account are described. These objects include the configuration information required to join fleets and image builders to Microsoft Active Directory domains.

Although the response syntax in this topic includes the account password, this password is not returned in the actual response.
DescribeDirectoryConfigs.name: DescribeDirectoryConfigs

DescribeFleets.documentation: Retrieves a list that describes one or more specified fleets, if the fleet names are provided. Otherwise, all fleets in the account are described.
DescribeFleets.name: DescribeFleets

DescribeImageBuilders.documentation: Retrieves a list that describes one or more specified image builders, if the image builder names are provided. Otherwise, all image builders in the account are described.
DescribeImageBuilders.name: DescribeImageBuilders

DescribeImagePermissions.documentation: Retrieves a list that describes the permissions for shared AWS account IDs on a private image that you own.
DescribeImagePermissions.name: DescribeImagePermissions

DescribeImages.documentation: Retrieves a list that describes one or more specified images, if the image names or image ARNs are provided. Otherwise, all images in the account are described.
DescribeImages.name: DescribeImages

DescribeSessions.documentation: Retrieves a list that describes the streaming sessions for a specified stack and fleet. If a UserId is provided for the stack and fleet, only streaming sessions for that user are described. If an authentication type is not provided, the default is to authenticate users using a streaming URL.
DescribeSessions.name: DescribeSessions

DescribeStacks.documentation: Retrieves a list that describes one or more specified stacks, if the stack names are provided. Otherwise, all stacks in the account are described.
DescribeStacks.name: DescribeStacks

DescribeUsageReportSubscriptions.documentation: Retrieves a list that describes one or more usage report subscriptions.
DescribeUsageReportSubscriptions.name: DescribeUsageReportSubscriptions

DescribeUserStackAssociations.documentation:
Retrieves a list that describes the UserStackAssociation objects. You must specify either or both of the following:

  • The stack name

  • The user name (email address of the user associated with the stack) and the authentication type for the user
DescribeUserStackAssociations.name: DescribeUserStackAssociations

DescribeUsers.documentation: Retrieves a list that describes one or more specified users in the user pool.
DescribeUsers.name: DescribeUsers

DisableUser.documentation: Disables the specified user in the user pool. Users can't sign in to AppStream 2.0 until they are re-enabled. This action does not delete the user.
DisableUser.name: DisableUser

DisassociateFleet.documentation: Disassociates the specified fleet from the specified stack.
DisassociateFleet.name: DisassociateFleet

EnableUser.documentation: Enables a user in the user pool. After being enabled, users can sign in to AppStream 2.0 and open applications from the stacks to which they are assigned.
EnableUser.name: EnableUser

ListAssociatedFleets.documentation: Retrieves the name of the fleet that is associated with the specified stack.
ListAssociatedFleets.name: ListAssociatedFleets

ListAssociatedStacks.documentation: Retrieves the name of the stack with which the specified fleet is associated.
ListAssociatedStacks.name: ListAssociatedStacks

ListTagsForResource.documentation:
Retrieves a list of all tags for the specified AppStream 2.0 resource. You can tag AppStream 2.0 image builders, images, fleets, and stacks.

For more information about tags, see Tagging Your Resources in the Amazon AppStream 2.0 Administration Guide.
ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource

TagResource.documentation:
Adds or overwrites one or more tags for the specified AppStream 2.0 resource. You can tag AppStream 2.0 image builders, images, fleets, and stacks.

Each tag consists of a key and an optional value. If a resource already has a tag with the same key, this operation updates its value.

To list the current tags for your resources, use ListTagsForResource. To disassociate tags from your resources, use UntagResource.

For more information about tags, see Tagging Your Resources in the Amazon AppStream 2.0 Administration Guide.
TagResource.name: TagResource

UntagResource.documentation:
Disassociates one or more specified tags from the specified AppStream 2.0 resource.

To list the current tags for your resources, use ListTagsForResource.

For more information about tags, see Tagging Your Resources in the Amazon AppStream 2.0 Administration Guide.
UntagResource.name: UntagResource

UpdateDirectoryConfig.documentation: Updates the specified Directory Config object in AppStream 2.0. This object includes the configuration information required to join fleets and image builders to Microsoft Active Directory domains.
UpdateDirectoryConfig.name: UpdateDirectoryConfig

UpdateFleet.documentation:
Updates the specified fleet.

If the fleet is in the STOPPED state, you can update any attribute except the fleet name. If the fleet is in the RUNNING state, you can update the DisplayName, ComputeCapacity, ImageARN, ImageName, IdleDisconnectTimeoutInSeconds, and DisconnectTimeoutInSeconds attributes. If the fleet is in the STARTING or STOPPING state, you can't update it.
UpdateFleet.name: UpdateFleet

UpdateImagePermissions.documentation: Adds or updates permissions for the specified private image.
UpdateImagePermissions.name: UpdateImagePermissions

UpdateStack.documentation: Updates the specified fields for the specified stack.
UpdateStack.name: UpdateStack

AccessEndpoint.documentation: Describes an interface VPC endpoint (interface endpoint) that lets you create a private connection between the virtual private cloud (VPC) that you specify and AppStream 2.0. When you specify an interface endpoint for a stack, users of the stack can connect to AppStream 2.0 only through that endpoint. When you specify an interface endpoint for an image builder, administrators can connect to the image builder only through that endpoint.

VpceId.documentation: The identifier (ID) of the VPC in which the interface endpoint is used.

Application.documentation: Describes an application in the application catalog.

Enabled.documentation: If there is a problem, the application can be disabled after image creation.

IconURL.documentation: The URL for the application icon. This URL might be time-limited.

LaunchParameters.documentation: The arguments that are passed to the application at launch.

LaunchPath.documentation: The path to the application executable in the instance.

ApplicationSettings.documentation: The persistent application settings for users of a stack.

Enabled.documentation: Enables or disables persistent application settings for users during their streaming sessions.

SettingsGroup.documentation: The path prefix for the S3 bucket where users’ persistent application settings are stored. You can allow the same persistent application settings to be used across multiple stacks by specifying the same settings group for each stack.

ApplicationSettingsResponse.documentation: Describes the persistent application settings for users of a stack.

Enabled.documentation: Specifies whether persistent application settings are enabled for users during their streaming sessions.

S3BucketName.documentation: The S3 bucket where users’ persistent application settings are stored. When persistent application settings are enabled for the first time for an account in an AWS Region, an S3 bucket is created. The bucket is unique to the AWS account and the Region.

SettingsGroup.documentation: The path prefix for the S3 bucket where users’ persistent application settings are stored.

ComputeCapacityStatus.documentation: Describes the capacity status for a fleet.

Available.documentation: The number of currently available instances that can be used to stream sessions.

InUse.documentation: The number of instances in use for streaming.

Running.documentation: The total number of simultaneous streaming instances that are running.

ConcurrentModificationException.documentation: An API error occurred. Wait a few minutes and try again.

DestinationImageDescription.documentation: The description that the image will have when it is copied to the destination.

DestinationImageName.documentation: The name that the image will have when it is copied to the destination.

DestinationRegion.documentation: The destination region to which the image will be copied. This parameter is required, even if you are copying an image within the same region.

SourceImageName.documentation: The name of the image to copy.

DirectoryName.documentation: The fully qualified name of the directory (for example, corp.example.com).

OrganizationalUnitDistinguishedNames.documentation: The distinguished names of the organizational units for computer accounts.

ServiceAccountCredentials.documentation: The credentials for the service account used by the fleet or image builder to connect to the directory.

DisconnectTimeoutInSeconds.documentation:
The amount of time that a streaming session remains active after users disconnect. If users try to reconnect to the streaming session after a disconnection or network interruption within this time interval, they are connected to their previous session. Otherwise, they are connected to a new session with a new streaming instance.

Specify a value between 60 and 360000.

DomainJoinInfo.documentation: The name of the directory and organizational unit (OU) to use to join the fleet to a Microsoft Active Directory domain.

EnableDefaultInternetAccess.documentation: Enables or disables default internet access for the fleet.

FleetType.documentation:
The fleet type.

ALWAYS_ON

Provides users with instant-on access to their apps. You are charged for all running instances in your fleet, even if no users are streaming apps.

ON_DEMAND

Provide users with access to applications after they connect, which takes one to two minutes. You are charged for instance streaming when users are connected and a small hourly fee for instances that are not streaming apps.

IamRoleArn.documentation:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role to apply to the fleet. To assume a role, a fleet instance calls the AWS Security Token Service (STS) AssumeRole API operation and passes the ARN of the role to use. The operation creates a new session with temporary credentials. AppStream 2.0 retrieves the temporary credentials and creates the AppStream_Machine_Role credential profile on the instance.

For more information, see Using an IAM Role to Grant Permissions to Applications and Scripts Running on AppStream 2.0 Streaming Instances in the Amazon AppStream 2.0 Administration Guide.

IdleDisconnectTimeoutInSeconds.documentation:
The amount of time that users can be idle (inactive) before they are disconnected from their streaming session and the DisconnectTimeoutInSeconds time interval begins. Users are notified before they are disconnected due to inactivity. If they try to reconnect to the streaming session before the time interval specified in DisconnectTimeoutInSeconds elapses, they are connected to their previous session. Users are considered idle when they stop providing keyboard or mouse input during their streaming session. File uploads and downloads, audio in, audio out, and pixels changing do not qualify as user activity. If users continue to be idle after the time interval in IdleDisconnectTimeoutInSeconds elapses, they are disconnected.

To prevent users from being disconnected due to inactivity, specify a value of 0. Otherwise, specify a value between 60 and 3600. The default value is 0.

If you enable this feature, we recommend that you specify a value that corresponds exactly to a whole number of minutes (for example, 60, 120, and 180). If you don't do this, the value is rounded to the nearest minute. For example, if you specify a value of 70, users are disconnected after 1 minute of inactivity. If you specify a value that is at the midpoint between two different minutes, the value is rounded up. For example, if you specify a value of 90, users are disconnected after 2 minutes of inactivity.

ImageArn.documentation: The ARN of the public, private, or shared image to use.

ImageName.documentation: The name of the image used to create the fleet.

InstanceType.documentation:
The instance type to use when launching fleet instances. The following instance types are available:

  • stream.standard.medium

  • stream.standard.large

  • stream.compute.large

  • stream.compute.xlarge

  • stream.compute.2xlarge

  • stream.compute.4xlarge

  • stream.compute.8xlarge

  • stream.memory.large

  • stream.memory.xlarge

  • stream.memory.2xlarge

  • stream.memory.4xlarge

  • stream.memory.8xlarge

  • stream.graphics-design.large

  • stream.graphics-design.xlarge

  • stream.graphics-design.2xlarge

  • stream.graphics-design.4xlarge

  • stream.graphics-desktop.2xlarge

  • stream.graphics-pro.4xlarge

  • stream.graphics-pro.8xlarge

  • stream.graphics-pro.16xlarge

MaxUserDurationInSeconds.documentation:
The maximum amount of time that a streaming session can remain active, in seconds. If users are still connected to a streaming instance five minutes before this limit is reached, they are prompted to save any open documents before being disconnected. After this time elapses, the instance is terminated and replaced by a new instance.

Specify a value between 600 and 360000.

Tags.documentation:
The tags to associate with the fleet. A tag is a key-value pair, and the value is optional. For example, Environment=Test. If you do not specify a value, Environment=.

If you do not specify a value, the value is set to an empty string.

Generally allowed characters are: letters, numbers, and spaces representable in UTF-8, and the following special characters:

_ . : / = + \ - @

For more information, see Tagging Your Resources in the Amazon AppStream 2.0 Administration Guide.

AccessEndpoints.documentation: The list of interface VPC endpoint (interface endpoint) objects. Administrators can connect to the image builder only through the specified endpoints.

AppstreamAgentVersion.documentation: The version of the AppStream 2.0 agent to use for this image builder. To use the latest version of the AppStream 2.0 agent, specify [LATEST].

DomainJoinInfo.documentation: The name of the directory and organizational unit (OU) to use to join the image builder to a Microsoft Active Directory domain.

EnableDefaultInternetAccess.documentation: Enables or disables default internet access for the image builder.

IamRoleArn.documentation:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role to apply to the image builder. To assume a role, the image builder calls the AWS Security Token Service (STS) AssumeRole API operation and passes the ARN of the role to use. The operation creates a new session with temporary credentials. AppStream 2.0 retrieves the temporary credentials and creates the AppStream_Machine_Role credential profile on the instance.

For more information, see Using an IAM Role to Grant Permissions to Applications and Scripts Running on AppStream 2.0 Streaming Instances in the Amazon AppStream 2.0 Administration Guide.

ImageArn.documentation: The ARN of the public, private, or shared image to use.

ImageName.documentation: The name of the image used to create the image builder.

InstanceType.documentation:
The instance type to use when launching the image builder. The following instance types are available:

  • stream.standard.medium

  • stream.standard.large

  • stream.compute.large

  • stream.compute.xlarge

  • stream.compute.2xlarge

  • stream.compute.4xlarge

  • stream.compute.8xlarge

  • stream.memory.large

  • stream.memory.xlarge

  • stream.memory.2xlarge

  • stream.memory.4xlarge

  • stream.memory.8xlarge

  • stream.graphics-design.large

  • stream.graphics-design.xlarge

  • stream.graphics-design.2xlarge

  • stream.graphics-design.4xlarge

  • stream.graphics-desktop.2xlarge

  • stream.graphics-pro.4xlarge

  • stream.graphics-pro.8xlarge

  • stream.graphics-pro.16xlarge

Name.documentation: A unique name for the image builder.

Tags.documentation:
The tags to associate with the image builder. A tag is a key-value pair, and the value is optional. For example, Environment=Test. If you do not specify a value, Environment=.

Generally allowed characters are: letters, numbers, and spaces representable in UTF-8, and the following special characters:

_ . : / = + \ - @

If you do not specify a value, the value is set to an empty string.

For more information about tags, see Tagging Your Resources in the Amazon AppStream 2.0 Administration Guide.

VpcConfig.documentation: The VPC configuration for the image builder. You can specify only one subnet.

Validity.documentation: The time that the streaming URL will be valid, in seconds. Specify a value between 1 and 604800 seconds. The default is 3600 seconds.

Expires.documentation: The elapsed time, in seconds after the Unix epoch, when this URL expires.

StreamingURL.documentation: The URL to start the AppStream 2.0 streaming session.

AccessEndpoints.documentation: The list of interface VPC endpoint (interface endpoint) objects. Users of the stack can connect to AppStream 2.0 only through the specified endpoints.

ApplicationSettings.documentation: The persistent application settings for users of a stack. When these settings are enabled, changes that users make to applications and Windows settings are automatically saved after each session and applied to the next session.

EmbedHostDomains.documentation: The domains where AppStream 2.0 streaming sessions can be embedded in an iframe. You must approve the domains that you want to host embedded AppStream 2.0 streaming sessions.

FeedbackURL.documentation: The URL that users are redirected to after they click the Send Feedback link. If no URL is specified, no Send Feedback link is displayed.

RedirectURL.documentation: The URL that users are redirected to after their streaming session ends.

Tags.documentation:
The tags to associate with the stack. A tag is a key-value pair, and the value is optional. For example, Environment=Test. If you do not specify a value, Environment=.

If you do not specify a value, the value is set to an empty string.

Generally allowed characters are: letters, numbers, and spaces representable in UTF-8, and the following special characters:

_ . : / = + \ - @

For more information about tags, see Tagging Your Resources in the Amazon AppStream 2.0 Administration Guide.

UserSettings.documentation: The actions that are enabled or disabled for users during their streaming sessions. By default, these actions are enabled.

ApplicationId.documentation: The name of the application to launch after the session starts. This is the name that you specified as Name in the Image Assistant.

SessionContext.documentation: The session context. For more information, see Session Context in the Amazon AppStream 2.0 Administration Guide.

Validity.documentation: The time that the streaming URL will be valid, in seconds. Specify a value between 1 and 604800 seconds. The default is 60 seconds.

Expires.documentation: The elapsed time, in seconds after the Unix epoch, when this URL expires.

StreamingURL.documentation: The URL to start the AppStream 2.0 streaming session.

S3BucketName.documentation:
The Amazon S3 bucket where generated reports are stored.

If you enabled on-instance session scripts and Amazon S3 logging for your session script configuration, AppStream 2.0 created an S3 bucket to store the script output. The bucket is unique to your account and Region. When you enable usage reporting in this case, AppStream 2.0 uses the same bucket to store your usage reports. If you haven't already enabled on-instance session scripts, when you enable usage reports, AppStream 2.0 creates a new S3 bucket.

AuthenticationType.documentation: The authentication type for the user. You must specify USERPOOL.

FirstName.documentation: The first name, or given name, of the user.

LastName.documentation: The last name, or surname, of the user.

MessageAction.documentation:
The action to take for the welcome email that is sent to a user after the user is created in the user pool. If you specify SUPPRESS, no email is sent. If you specify RESEND, do not specify the first name or last name of the user. If the value is null, the email is sent.

The temporary password in the welcome email is valid for only 7 days. If users don’t set their passwords within 7 days, you must send them a new welcome email.

UserName.documentation:
The email address of the user.

Users' email addresses are case-sensitive. During login, if they specify an email address that doesn't use the same capitalization as the email address specified when their user pool account was created, a "user does not exist" error message displays.

SharedAccountId.documentation: The 12-digit identifier of the AWS account for which to delete image permissions.

AuthenticationType.documentation: The authentication type for the user. You must specify USERPOOL.

UserName.documentation:
The email address of the user.

Users' email addresses are case-sensitive.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum size of each page of results.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.

DirectoryConfigs.documentation: Information about the directory configurations. Note that although the response syntax in this topic includes the account password, this password is not returned in the actual response.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.

Names.documentation: The names of the fleets to describe.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.
The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum size of each page of results.

Names.documentation: The names of the image builders to describe.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.
The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum size of each page of results.

Name.documentation: The name of the private image for which to describe permissions. The image must be one that you own.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.

SharedAwsAccountIds.documentation: The 12-digit identifier of one or more AWS accounts with which the image is shared.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.

SharedImagePermissionsList.documentation: The permissions for a private image that you own.

Arns.documentation: The ARNs of the public, private, and shared images to describe.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum size of each page of results.

Names.documentation: The names of the public or private images to describe.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.

Type.documentation: The type of image (public, private, or shared) to describe.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.

AuthenticationType.documentation: The authentication method. Specify API for a user authenticated using a streaming URL or SAML for a SAML federated user. The default is to authenticate users using a streaming URL.

FleetName.documentation: The name of the fleet. This value is case-sensitive.

Limit.documentation: The size of each page of results. The default value is 20 and the maximum value is 50.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.

StackName.documentation: The name of the stack. This value is case-sensitive.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.

Names.documentation: The names of the stacks to describe.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.
The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum size of each page of results.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.
The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.

AuthenticationType.documentation: The authentication type for the user who is associated with the stack. You must specify USERPOOL.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum size of each page of results.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.

StackName.documentation: The name of the stack that is associated with the user.

UserName.documentation:
The email address of the user who is associated with the stack.

Users' email addresses are case-sensitive.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.

AuthenticationType.documentation: The authentication type for the users in the user pool to describe. You must specify USERPOOL.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum size of each page of results.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.
The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.

Users.documentation: Information about users in the user pool.

DirectoryConfig.documentation: Describes the configuration information required to join fleets and image builders to Microsoft Active Directory domains.

CreatedTime.documentation: The time the directory configuration was created.

DirectoryName.documentation: The fully qualified name of the directory (for example, corp.example.com).

OrganizationalUnitDistinguishedNames.documentation: The distinguished names of the organizational units for computer accounts.

ServiceAccountCredentials.documentation: The credentials for the service account used by the fleet or image builder to connect to the directory.

AuthenticationType.documentation: The authentication type for the user. You must specify USERPOOL.

UserName.documentation:
The email address of the user.

Users' email addresses are case-sensitive.

DomainJoinInfo.documentation: Describes the configuration information required to join fleets and image builders to Microsoft Active Directory domains.

DirectoryName.documentation: The fully qualified name of the directory (for example, corp.example.com).

OrganizationalUnitDistinguishedName.documentation: The distinguished name of the organizational unit for computer accounts.

EmbedHostDomain.documentation: Specifies a valid domain that can embed AppStream. Valid examples include: ["testorigin.tt--com", "testingorigin.com.us", "test.com.us"] Invalid examples include: ["test,com", ".com", "h*llo.com". ""]

AuthenticationType.documentation: The authentication type for the user. You must specify USERPOOL.

UserName.documentation:
The email address of the user.

Users' email addresses are case-sensitive. During login, if they specify an email address that doesn't use the same capitalization as the email address specified when their user pool account was created, a "user does not exist" error message displays.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the fleet.

DisconnectTimeoutInSeconds.documentation:
The amount of time that a streaming session remains active after users disconnect. If they try to reconnect to the streaming session after a disconnection or network interruption within this time interval, they are connected to their previous session. Otherwise, they are connected to a new session with a new streaming instance.

Specify a value between 60 and 360000.

DomainJoinInfo.documentation: The name of the directory and organizational unit (OU) to use to join the fleet to a Microsoft Active Directory domain.

EnableDefaultInternetAccess.documentation: Indicates whether default internet access is enabled for the fleet.

FleetType.documentation:
The fleet type.

ALWAYS_ON

Provides users with instant-on access to their apps. You are charged for all running instances in your fleet, even if no users are streaming apps.

ON_DEMAND

Provide users with access to applications after they connect, which takes one to two minutes. You are charged for instance streaming when users are connected and a small hourly fee for instances that are not streaming apps.

IamRoleArn.documentation:
The ARN of the IAM role that is applied to the fleet. To assume a role, the fleet instance calls the AWS Security Token Service (STS) AssumeRole API operation and passes the ARN of the role to use. The operation creates a new session with temporary credentials. AppStream 2.0 retrieves the temporary credentials and creates the AppStream_Machine_Role credential profile on the instance.

For more information, see Using an IAM Role to Grant Permissions to Applications and Scripts Running on AppStream 2.0 Streaming Instances in the Amazon AppStream 2.0 Administration Guide.

IdleDisconnectTimeoutInSeconds.documentation:
The amount of time that users can be idle (inactive) before they are disconnected from their streaming session and the DisconnectTimeoutInSeconds time interval begins. Users are notified before they are disconnected due to inactivity. If users try to reconnect to the streaming session before the time interval specified in DisconnectTimeoutInSeconds elapses, they are connected to their previous session. Users are considered idle when they stop providing keyboard or mouse input during their streaming session. File uploads and downloads, audio in, audio out, and pixels changing do not qualify as user activity. If users continue to be idle after the time interval in IdleDisconnectTimeoutInSeconds elapses, they are disconnected.

To prevent users from being disconnected due to inactivity, specify a value of 0. Otherwise, specify a value between 60 and 3600. The default value is 0.

If you enable this feature, we recommend that you specify a value that corresponds exactly to a whole number of minutes (for example, 60, 120, and 180). If you don't do this, the value is rounded to the nearest minute. For example, if you specify a value of 70, users are disconnected after 1 minute of inactivity. If you specify a value that is at the midpoint between two different minutes, the value is rounded up. For example, if you specify a value of 90, users are disconnected after 2 minutes of inactivity.

ImageArn.documentation: The ARN for the public, private, or shared image.

ImageName.documentation: The name of the image used to create the fleet.

InstanceType.documentation:
The instance type to use when launching fleet instances. The following instance types are available:

  • stream.standard.medium

  • stream.standard.large

  • stream.compute.large

  • stream.compute.xlarge

  • stream.compute.2xlarge

  • stream.compute.4xlarge

  • stream.compute.8xlarge

  • stream.memory.large

  • stream.memory.xlarge

  • stream.memory.2xlarge

  • stream.memory.4xlarge

  • stream.memory.8xlarge

  • stream.graphics-design.large

  • stream.graphics-design.xlarge

  • stream.graphics-design.2xlarge

  • stream.graphics-design.4xlarge

  • stream.graphics-desktop.2xlarge

  • stream.graphics-pro.4xlarge

  • stream.graphics-pro.8xlarge

  • stream.graphics-pro.16xlarge

MaxUserDurationInSeconds.documentation:
The maximum amount of time that a streaming session can remain active, in seconds. If users are still connected to a streaming instance five minutes before this limit is reached, they are prompted to save any open documents before being disconnected. After this time elapses, the instance is terminated and replaced by a new instance.

Specify a value between 600 and 360000.

AppstreamAgentVersion.documentation: The version of the AppStream 2.0 agent to use for instances that are launched from this image.

BaseImageArn.documentation: The ARN of the image from which this image was created.

ImageBuilderName.documentation: The name of the image builder that was used to create the private image. If the image is shared, this value is null.

ImageBuilderSupported.documentation: Indicates whether an image builder can be launched from this image.

ImagePermissions.documentation: The permissions to provide to the destination AWS account for the specified image.

Platform.documentation: The operating system platform of the image.

PublicBaseImageReleasedDate.documentation: The release date of the public base image. For private images, this date is the release date of the base image from which the image was created.

State.documentation: The image starts in the PENDING state. If image creation succeeds, the state is AVAILABLE. If image creation fails, the state is FAILED.

StateChangeReason.documentation: The reason why the last state change occurred.

Visibility.documentation: Indicates whether the image is public or private.

ImageBuilder.documentation: Describes a virtual machine that is used to create an image.

AccessEndpoints.documentation: The list of virtual private cloud (VPC) interface endpoint objects. Administrators can connect to the image builder only through the specified endpoints.

AppstreamAgentVersion.documentation: The version of the AppStream 2.0 agent that is currently being used by the image builder.

CreatedTime.documentation: The time stamp when the image builder was created.

DomainJoinInfo.documentation: The name of the directory and organizational unit (OU) to use to join the image builder to a Microsoft Active Directory domain.

EnableDefaultInternetAccess.documentation: Enables or disables default internet access for the image builder.

IamRoleArn.documentation:
The ARN of the IAM role that is applied to the image builder. To assume a role, the image builder calls the AWS Security Token Service (STS) AssumeRole API operation and passes the ARN of the role to use. The operation creates a new session with temporary credentials. AppStream 2.0 retrieves the temporary credentials and creates the AppStream_Machine_Role credential profile on the instance.

For more information, see Using an IAM Role to Grant Permissions to Applications and Scripts Running on AppStream 2.0 Streaming Instances in the Amazon AppStream 2.0 Administration Guide.

ImageArn.documentation: The ARN of the image from which this builder was created.

InstanceType.documentation:
The instance type for the image builder. The following instance types are available:

  • stream.standard.medium

  • stream.standard.large

  • stream.compute.large

  • stream.compute.xlarge

  • stream.compute.2xlarge

  • stream.compute.4xlarge

  • stream.compute.8xlarge

  • stream.memory.large

  • stream.memory.xlarge

  • stream.memory.2xlarge

  • stream.memory.4xlarge

  • stream.memory.8xlarge

  • stream.graphics-design.large

  • stream.graphics-design.xlarge

  • stream.graphics-design.2xlarge

  • stream.graphics-design.4xlarge

  • stream.graphics-desktop.2xlarge

  • stream.graphics-pro.4xlarge

  • stream.graphics-pro.8xlarge

  • stream.graphics-pro.16xlarge

Platform.documentation: The operating system platform of the image builder.

StateChangeReason.documentation: The reason why the last state change occurred.

VpcConfig.documentation: The VPC configuration of the image builder.

ImageBuilderStateChangeReason.documentation: Describes the reason why the last image builder state change occurred.

allowFleet.documentation: Indicates whether the image can be used for a fleet.

allowImageBuilder.documentation: Indicates whether the image can be used for an image builder.

ImageStateChangeReason.documentation: Describes the reason why the last image state change occurred.

IncompatibleImageException.documentation: The image does not support storage connectors.

InvalidAccountStatusException.documentation: The resource cannot be created because your AWS account is suspended. For assistance, contact AWS Support.

InvalidParameterCombinationException.documentation: Indicates an incorrect combination of parameters, or a missing parameter.

LastReportGenerationExecutionError.documentation: Describes the error that is returned when a usage report can't be generated.

ErrorCode.documentation: The error code for the error that is returned when a usage report can't be generated.

ErrorMessage.documentation: The error message for the error that is returned when a usage report can't be generated.

LimitExceededException.documentation: The requested limit exceeds the permitted limit for an account.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.
The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.
The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.
The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.

ResourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

NetworkAccessConfiguration.documentation: Describes the network details of the fleet or image builder instance.

EniId.documentation: The resource identifier of the elastic network interface that is attached to instances in your VPC. All network interfaces have the eni-xxxxxxxx resource identifier.

EniPrivateIpAddress.documentation: The private IP address of the elastic network interface that is attached to instances in your VPC.

ResourceNotAvailableException.documentation: The specified resource exists and is not in use, but isn't available.

ServiceAccountCredentials.documentation: Describes the credentials for the service account used by the fleet or image builder to connect to the directory.

AccountName.documentation: The user name of the account. This account must have the following privileges: create computer objects, join computers to the domain, and change/reset the password on descendant computer objects for the organizational units specified.

AuthenticationType.documentation: The authentication method. The user is authenticated using a streaming URL (API) or SAML 2.0 federation (SAML).

ConnectionState.documentation: Specifies whether a user is connected to the streaming session.

FleetName.documentation: The name of the fleet for the streaming session.

MaxExpirationTime.documentation: The time when the streaming session is set to expire. This time is based on the MaxUserDurationinSeconds value, which determines the maximum length of time that a streaming session can run. A streaming session might end earlier than the time specified in SessionMaxExpirationTime, when the DisconnectTimeOutInSeconds elapses or the user chooses to end his or her session. If the DisconnectTimeOutInSeconds elapses, or the user chooses to end his or her session, the streaming instance is terminated and the streaming session ends.

NetworkAccessConfiguration.documentation: The network details for the streaming session.

StackName.documentation: The name of the stack for the streaming session.

StartTime.documentation: The time when a streaming instance is dedicated for the user.

State.documentation: The current state of the streaming session.

UserId.documentation: The identifier of the user for whom the session was created.

SessionState.documentation: Possible values for the state of a streaming session.

SharedImagePermissions.documentation: Describes the permissions that are available to the specified AWS account for a shared image.

imagePermissions.documentation: Describes the permissions for a shared image.

sharedAccountId.documentation: The 12-digit identifier of the AWS account with which the image is shared.

AccessEndpoints.documentation: The list of virtual private cloud (VPC) interface endpoint objects. Users of the stack can connect to AppStream 2.0 only through the specified endpoints.

ApplicationSettings.documentation: The persistent application settings for users of the stack.

EmbedHostDomains.documentation: The domains where AppStream 2.0 streaming sessions can be embedded in an iframe. You must approve the domains that you want to host embedded AppStream 2.0 streaming sessions.

FeedbackURL.documentation: The URL that users are redirected to after they click the Send Feedback link. If no URL is specified, no Send Feedback link is displayed.

RedirectURL.documentation: The URL that users are redirected to after their streaming session ends.

UserSettings.documentation: The actions that are enabled or disabled for users during their streaming sessions. By default these actions are enabled.

AppstreamAgentVersion.documentation: The version of the AppStream 2.0 agent to use for this image builder. To use the latest version of the AppStream 2.0 agent, specify [LATEST].

StorageConnector.documentation: Describes a connector that enables persistent storage for users.

Domains.documentation: The names of the domains for the account.

ResourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

Tags.documentation:
The tags to associate. A tag is a key-value pair, and the value is optional. For example, Environment=Test. If you do not specify a value, Environment=.

If you do not specify a value, the value is set to an empty string.

Generally allowed characters are: letters, numbers, and spaces representable in UTF-8, and the following special characters:

_ . : / = + \ - @

ResourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

TagKeys.documentation: The tag keys for the tags to disassociate.

DirectoryName.documentation: The name of the Directory Config object.

OrganizationalUnitDistinguishedNames.documentation: The distinguished names of the organizational units for computer accounts.

ServiceAccountCredentials.documentation: The credentials for the service account used by the fleet or image builder to connect to the directory.

DeleteVpcConfig.documentation: Deletes the VPC association for the specified fleet.

DisconnectTimeoutInSeconds.documentation:
The amount of time that a streaming session remains active after users disconnect. If users try to reconnect to the streaming session after a disconnection or network interruption within this time interval, they are connected to their previous session. Otherwise, they are connected to a new session with a new streaming instance.

Specify a value between 60 and 360000.

DomainJoinInfo.documentation: The name of the directory and organizational unit (OU) to use to join the fleet to a Microsoft Active Directory domain.

EnableDefaultInternetAccess.documentation: Enables or disables default internet access for the fleet.

IamRoleArn.documentation:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role to apply to the fleet. To assume a role, a fleet instance calls the AWS Security Token Service (STS) AssumeRole API operation and passes the ARN of the role to use. The operation creates a new session with temporary credentials. AppStream 2.0 retrieves the temporary credentials and creates the AppStream_Machine_Role credential profile on the instance.

For more information, see Using an IAM Role to Grant Permissions to Applications and Scripts Running on AppStream 2.0 Streaming Instances in the Amazon AppStream 2.0 Administration Guide.

IdleDisconnectTimeoutInSeconds.documentation:
The amount of time that users can be idle (inactive) before they are disconnected from their streaming session and the DisconnectTimeoutInSeconds time interval begins. Users are notified before they are disconnected due to inactivity. If users try to reconnect to the streaming session before the time interval specified in DisconnectTimeoutInSeconds elapses, they are connected to their previous session. Users are considered idle when they stop providing keyboard or mouse input during their streaming session. File uploads and downloads, audio in, audio out, and pixels changing do not qualify as user activity. If users continue to be idle after the time interval in IdleDisconnectTimeoutInSeconds elapses, they are disconnected.

To prevent users from being disconnected due to inactivity, specify a value of 0. Otherwise, specify a value between 60 and 3600. The default value is 0.

If you enable this feature, we recommend that you specify a value that corresponds exactly to a whole number of minutes (for example, 60, 120, and 180). If you don't do this, the value is rounded to the nearest minute. For example, if you specify a value of 70, users are disconnected after 1 minute of inactivity. If you specify a value that is at the midpoint between two different minutes, the value is rounded up. For example, if you specify a value of 90, users are disconnected after 2 minutes of inactivity.

ImageArn.documentation: The ARN of the public, private, or shared image to use.

ImageName.documentation: The name of the image used to create the fleet.

InstanceType.documentation:
The instance type to use when launching fleet instances. The following instance types are available:

  • stream.standard.medium

  • stream.standard.large

  • stream.compute.large

  • stream.compute.xlarge

  • stream.compute.2xlarge

  • stream.compute.4xlarge

  • stream.compute.8xlarge

  • stream.memory.large

  • stream.memory.xlarge

  • stream.memory.2xlarge

  • stream.memory.4xlarge

  • stream.memory.8xlarge

  • stream.graphics-design.large

  • stream.graphics-design.xlarge

  • stream.graphics-design.2xlarge

  • stream.graphics-design.4xlarge

  • stream.graphics-desktop.2xlarge

  • stream.graphics-pro.4xlarge

  • stream.graphics-pro.8xlarge

  • stream.graphics-pro.16xlarge

MaxUserDurationInSeconds.documentation:
The maximum amount of time that a streaming session can remain active, in seconds. If users are still connected to a streaming instance five minutes before this limit is reached, they are prompted to save any open documents before being disconnected. After this time elapses, the instance is terminated and replaced by a new instance.

Specify a value between 600 and 360000.

SharedAccountId.documentation: The 12-digit identifier of the AWS account for which you want add or update image permissions.

AccessEndpoints.documentation: The list of interface VPC endpoint (interface endpoint) objects. Users of the stack can connect to AppStream 2.0 only through the specified endpoints.

ApplicationSettings.documentation: The persistent application settings for users of a stack. When these settings are enabled, changes that users make to applications and Windows settings are automatically saved after each session and applied to the next session.

DeleteStorageConnectors.documentation: Deletes the storage connectors currently enabled for the stack.

EmbedHostDomains.documentation: The domains where AppStream 2.0 streaming sessions can be embedded in an iframe. You must approve the domains that you want to host embedded AppStream 2.0 streaming sessions.

FeedbackURL.documentation: The URL that users are redirected to after they choose the Send Feedback link. If no URL is specified, no Send Feedback link is displayed.

RedirectURL.documentation: The URL that users are redirected to after their streaming session ends.

UserSettings.documentation: The actions that are enabled or disabled for users during their streaming sessions. By default, these actions are enabled.

UsageReportSubscription.documentation: Describes information about the usage report subscription.

LastGeneratedReportDate.documentation: The time when the last usage report was generated.

S3BucketName.documentation:
The Amazon S3 bucket where generated reports are stored.

If you enabled on-instance session scripts and Amazon S3 logging for your session script configuration, AppStream 2.0 created an S3 bucket to store the script output. The bucket is unique to your account and Region. When you enable usage reporting in this case, AppStream 2.0 uses the same bucket to store your usage reports. If you haven't already enabled on-instance session scripts, when you enable usage reports, AppStream 2.0 creates a new S3 bucket.

SubscriptionErrors.documentation: The errors that were returned if usage reports couldn't be generated.

User.documentation: Describes a user in the user pool.

CreatedTime.documentation: The date and time the user was created in the user pool.

Enabled.documentation: Specifies whether the user in the user pool is enabled.

FirstName.documentation: The first name, or given name, of the user.

LastName.documentation: The last name, or surname, of the user.

Status.documentation:
The status of the user in the user pool. The status can be one of the following:

  • UNCONFIRMED – The user is created but not confirmed.

  • CONFIRMED – The user is confirmed.

  • ARCHIVED – The user is no longer active.

  • COMPROMISED – The user is disabled because of a potential security threat.

  • UNKNOWN – The user status is not known.

UserName.documentation:
The email address of the user.

Users' email addresses are case-sensitive.

UserSetting.documentation: Describes an action and whether the action is enabled or disabled for users during their streaming sessions.

Action.documentation: The action that is enabled or disabled.

Permission.documentation: Indicates whether the action is enabled or disabled.

UserStackAssociation.documentation: Describes a user in the user pool and the associated stack.

SendEmailNotification.documentation: Specifies whether a welcome email is sent to a user after the user is created in the user pool.

StackName.documentation: The name of the stack that is associated with the user.

UserName.documentation:
The email address of the user who is associated with the stack.

Users' email addresses are case-sensitive.

UserStackAssociationError.documentation: Describes the error that is returned when a user can’t be associated with or disassociated from a stack.

ErrorCode.documentation: The error code for the error that is returned when a user can’t be associated with or disassociated from a stack.

ErrorMessage.documentation: The error message for the error that is returned when a user can’t be associated with or disassociated from a stack.

UserStackAssociation.documentation: Information about the user and associated stack.

VpcConfig.documentation: Describes VPC configuration information for fleets and image builders.

SecurityGroupIds.documentation: The identifiers of the security groups for the fleet or image builder.

SubnetIds.documentation: The identifiers of the subnets to which a network interface is attached from the fleet instance or image builder instance. Fleet instances use one or more subnets. Image builder instances use one subnet.
